newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran president plays down differences with Syria.
newsitem.headline: Iran president plays down differences with Syria.

text.p: Iranian President Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani on Monday played down differences with Syria, its closest Arab ally, in a meeting with a Syrian official.

The visit by Syrian Vice-President Abdel-Halim Khaddam follows sharp criticism by Iran's media of Syria's approval of a decision by Arab ministers backing the United Arab Emirates in its territorial row with Iran over three islands in the Gulf.

"Regional countries should avoid non-essential problems and mobilise all their capabilities against the sinister policies of those (Israel) who occupy Qods (Jerusalem) and their global backers," Tehran radio quoted Rafsanjani as saying.
Khaddam described ties between Syria and Iran as "friendly and strategic", the radio added.
Khaddam and Foreign Minister Farouq al-Shara, accompanied by several cabinet ministers, left Tehran on Monday at the end of the two-day visit.
The Syrian officials also met their Iranian counterparts and attended meetings of a joint commission assigned to promote bilateral cooperation.
Syria backed Iran during its 1980-1988 war with Iraq and is Tehran's closest Arab ally.
